list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Update .idea metadata and improve dry run message formatting
Updated comments and tasks in .idea/workspace.xml for better clarity and added new local tasks. Enhanced the dry run output in ghw.py to include backticks for better readability.

task.summary:
Add AI-based commit message generation
Introduced AI-based commit message generation with support for ChatGPT and Claude services. Updated `setup.py` to version `1.1.0`, modified `src/ghw.py` to include new arguments for AI services, and added several new Python modules to facilitate the integration. Modified the README to document new features and usage.

Update actions/upload-artifact to v4 in release workflow
Upgraded the GitHub Actions upload-artifact to version v4 in the release.yml file. Additionally, removed unnecessary change tracking entries and added metadata for new AI-based commit message generation features in workspace.xml.

Refactor import paths for AI service modules
Updated the import statements for `AIServiceFactory` and `CommitMessageGenerator` to reflect their new paths under the `src` directory. This change improves module organization and clarity within the project structure.

Refactor import paths for AI service modules
Updated import statements to use `src` directory paths for better module organization and clarity. This change ensures consistency across the project and improves maintainability.

Update import path for AIService
Changed the import path for AIService in commit.py to use an absolute path from the src directory. This ensures consistency and avoids potential issues with relative imports.

Switch from ai to openai for API calls
Updated the ChatGPTService to use the openai library instead of ai for API key assignment and completion creation. This change ensures compatibility with the openai's latest API adjustments.

Update .idea metadata and improve dry run message formatting
Updated comments and tasks in .idea/workspace.xml for better clarity and added new local tasks. Enhanced the dry run output in ghw.py to include backticks for better readability.
